paragraphs.text:
%md
# **WorldWideWeb**

by Anish Singh
blog site : [Zeppelin Notes](http://zeppelinnotes.blogspot.in)
[Image]

#### Introduction
**WorldWideWeb** is a notebook that explores web crawl data and performs analysis on that data to gain interesting insights. The data used for the analysis is open data made available by the
common crawl organization which provides web crawl data for free and open use. The common crawl organization builds and maintains an open repository web crawl data that can be  accessed  and
analysed by anyone. They have the web crawl data for the last seven years and the data is available in three formats : the WARC format, containing the raw crawl data, the WAT format, contain
-ing the metadata for the crawled data and the WET format, containing the text extracted from the crawled data. The WARC format has largely been used for analysis in this  notebook  and  the
other formats have been used as and when required. For the analysis and manipulation of the Warc format files, no tool other than the Warcbase library could have been more useful.  The  data
for only the month of May 2016 has been considered as the entire corpus is too large to be analysed at once, considering the fact that this notebook was running on a m4.xlarge EC2  instance.
The data for the month of May is divided into segments and only six segments have been considered, again due to the restricting capabilities of the machine used to design this notebook. More
information about the design of the notebook and choosing of the data sets may be found on the blogsite mentioned above.

This notebook uses Apache Spark for analysis of common crawl data and the visualization capabilities of Apache Zeppelin.

%sh
#this paragraph downlaods the common crawl datasets needed for analysis

#download the datasets for the first three segments of May
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg1.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464049270134.8/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524002110-00000-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg2.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464049270134.8/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524002110-00001-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg3.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464049270134.8/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524002110-00000-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"
 
#download the datasets for the last two segments of May
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/commonCrawl/MayWarcSeg4.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464056639771.99/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524022359-00242-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/commonCrawl/MayWarcSeg5.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464056639771.99/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524022359-00243-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"
 wget -O ~/ZeppelinData/commonCrawl/MayWarcSeg6.warc.gz "https://commoncrawl.s3.amazonaws.com/crawl-data/CC-MAIN-2016-22/segments/1464056639771.99/warc/CC-MAIN-20160524022359-00244-ip-10-185-217-139.ec2.internal.warc.gz"

//this paragraph loads the datasets in zeppelin for analysis
import org.warcbase.spark.matchbox._
import org.warcbase.spark.rdd.RecordRDD._

val mayWarcSeg1 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg1.warc.gz", sc)        //load the data sets for the first three segments of May
val mayWarcSeg2 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg2.warc.gz", sc)
val mayWarcSeg3 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg3.warc.gz", sc)

val mayBegData  = mayWarcSeg1.union(mayWarcSeg2).union(mayWarcSeg3)                     //combine the data for the first three segments of May 

val mayWarcSeg4 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg4.warc.gz", sc)        //load the data sets for the last three segments of May
val mayWarcSeg5 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg5.warc.gz", sc)
val mayWarcSeg6 = RecordLoader.loadArchives("/home/ubuntu/ZeppelinData/CommonCrawl/MayWarcSeg6.warc.gz", sc)

val mayEndData = mayWarcSeg4.union(mayWarcSeg5).union(mayWarcSeg6)                      //combine the data for the last three segments of May
